caption:
The photograph depicts a rural scene with a focus on pastoral activities. In the foreground and lower part of the image, there is a lush landscape partially framed by blurred green leaves at the top, giving a sense of looking through a hidden spot or a natural window.

The central and most prominent feature of the image is a sinuous river or stream, winding through a dense forest. The river, reflecting some light, contrasts visually with the surrounding thick green foliage.

To the left of the frame, on a sloped field, a tractor trailed by what seems to be a hay baler is captured in the middle of agricultural work. This equipment is creating patterned rows in the field, possibly laying down hay or collecting it, which adds a geometric aspect to the otherwise natural landscape.

The scene encapsulates a serene and isolated atmosphere, typical of a secluded farmland area, possibly hinting at the activities of rural life and agriculture. The overall composition, dominated by shades of green and the natural curve of the river, gives a sense of peace and tranquility.
title: Valley farm hay baling operation on the Niangua River just above pont where the river joins the lake proper off Route J. This farm is similar to many that were submerged when Lake Ozark was created by Bagnell Dam.
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
